clueClient
Class BoardModel

java.lang.Object
  clueClient.BoardModel

public class BoardModel
extends Object

Class semantics and roles:
The BoardModel is the Model (as per Java's Model-View-Controller approach to GUI design) for the Clue system. The BoardModel represents the logical model of the Clue game.
The class contains a reference to the Client object also on the client-side so as to be able to update visual displays as it updates logical game-state data.

Information maintenance:
Creation: the BoardModel is created when the Client creates it at the start of a client-side process
Deletion: the BoardModel is deleted when the Client has stopped executing

Author:
Michael Philippone (Class Skeletons and Code)

Nested Class Summary
 class BoardModel.Card
          Class semantics and roles:
The Card class is an inner class that represents a single card in the gamer's hand.
 class BoardModel.Cell
          Class semantics and roles:
The Cell class is an inner class that represents a single grid square on the board.

 void haveCards(String cardsIn)

Preconditions: there has been a "havecard" message received from the server
Postconditions: the gamer's hand of cards has been 'dealt'
 void parseUpdateString(String updateStr)
          Purpose: parse through the string to create the board update array
Preconditions: there has been an update message received from the server with cells specified for updating on the board object
Postconditions: there has been an array created for board cell updating
Pseudo-Code:
BEGIN
- split the string on the ";" (semicolon) characters into SPLIT_1
- FOR EACH string in SPLIT_1:
- - split the string on the "," (comma) characters into 3 new strings, STR_A, STR_B, STR_C, STR_D
- - call update(STR_A, STR_B, STR_C, STR_D)
END

NOTE: The string passed to this method should be formatted as follows:
"X1,Y1,STATE1,CLICKABLE;X2,Y2,STATE2,CLICKABLE;X3,Y4,STATE3,CLICKABLE;...;Xn,Yn,STATE4,CLICKABLE"
Tuples of the form (X,Y,STATE) are separated by a semicolon, ";"
X: the x coordinate of the cell to update
Y: the y coordinate of the cell to update
STATE: how should the cell be updated (see "REPO://src/SocektStringProtocol.txt" for a full rundown of socket string syntax)
 void update(int x, int y, String color, boolean clickable)
          Purpose: Method takes in a coordinate pair and an unparsed method and performs the specified update directed in updateMessage parameter.

Method Detail

haveCards

public void haveCards(String cardsIn)
Purpose: loads the passed in card names into BoardModel.Card objects in the card array
Preconditions: there has been a "havecard" message received from the server
Postconditions: the gamer's hand of cards has been 'dealt'

Parameters:
cardsIn - the names of the cards to update, separated by ";" (semicolon) characters

chooseCards

public void chooseCards(String names)
Purpose: Makes the selected card ready for choosing (in order to disprove another player's guess on the Server side)
Preconditions: there has been a "choosecard" message received from the server
Postconditions: there are clickable cards in the gamer's hand

Parameters:
names - the names of the cards to update

update

public void update(int x,
                   int y,
                   String color,
                   boolean clickable)
Purpose: Method takes in a coordinate pair and an unparsed method and performs the specified update directed in updateMessage parameter.

Precondition: The board is in some state
Postcondition: the board's state is altered based on the directive in updateMessage and at BoardModel.Cell (X,Y)
Pseudo-Code:
BEGIN
- assign cell at (param0,param1) to have the clickable value of param3
- assign cell at (param0,param1) to have the background color of the corresponding RGB value of the color (string) in param2
END

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate of the update to occur
y - the y coordinate of the update to occur
color - Which color string should we match against from Utilities
clickable - is the cell to be updated allowed to be clicked?

parseUpdateString

public void parseUpdateString(String updateStr)
Purpose: parse through the string to create the board update array
Preconditions: there has been an update message received from the server with cells specified for updating on the board object
Postconditions: there has been an array created for board cell updating
Pseudo-Code:
BEGIN
- split the string on the ";" (semicolon) characters into SPLIT_1
- FOR EACH string in SPLIT_1:
- - split the string on the "," (comma) characters into 3 new strings, STR_A, STR_B, STR_C, STR_D
- - call update(STR_A, STR_B, STR_C, STR_D)
END

NOTE: The string passed to this method should be formatted as follows:
"X1,Y1,STATE1,CLICKABLE;X2,Y2,STATE2,CLICKABLE;X3,Y4,STATE3,CLICKABLE;...;Xn,Yn,STATE4,CLICKABLE"
Tuples of the form (X,Y,STATE) are separated by a semicolon, ";"
X: the x coordinate of the cell to update
Y: the y coordinate of the cell to update
STATE: how should the cell be updated (see "REPO://src/SocektStringProtocol.txt" for a full rundown of socket string syntax)

Parameters:
updateStr - the string from the server's socket communication

getnumCards

public int getnumCards()
Deprecated. use the sum of rooms, weapons, and game pieces, ie: Utilities.pieceNames.length + Utilities.roomNames.length + Utilities.weaponNames.length

Purpose: get the number of cards held in this gamer's hand
Preconditions: there is an array of initialized BoardModel.Cards
Postconditions: none

Returns:
an int corresponding to the number of cards
